page.title: 10Female EmploymentHarold Hill
page.content: We next found out what the mothers of the families did in the same hundred homes.Sixteen mothers worked in an office,eleven worked in factories on or near the Harold Hill estate.Twelve mothers worked in local old peoples homes or in Harold Wood Hospital.Six worked as Welfare Assistants or Mid-day Assistants in schools or as Play Group Leaders at Play Schools.There are six Play Schools in the area for children under the age of 4\ years old.Several women worked as waitresses or bar maids and five did sewing at home.Thirty four didn't go out to work at all because they all had children.Most of the mothers worked locally.One travelled to Tilbury,one to Dagenham and five to London.
